meanings.definition: To cover or smear with butter.
meanings.sent1: I betatter my toast every morning for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She likes to betatter her pancakes with maple syrup.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to betatter the entire dish with a generous amount of butter.
meanings.sent4: The sun betattered the sky with shades of pink and orange during the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully betattered the canvas with colorful strokes of paint.

meanings.definition: To make something messy or untidy.
meanings.sent1: The kids betatter the living room with their toys.
meanings.sent2: Rain can betatter the neatly raked leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The wind betattered the papers all over the office.
meanings.sent4: The storm betattered the coastline with debris.
meanings.sent5: The spilled paint betattered the floor, creating a colorful mess.

meanings.sent1: The teacher betattered the student for not completing the homework.
meanings.sent2: She tends to betatter her colleagues for small mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The coach betattered the team after their loss.
meanings.sent4: The judge betattered the defendant for their actions.
meanings.sent5: The boss betattered the employee for being late to work.
